name: Wacky True Facts Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to scientists, what is the most flatulent bean?
questions.explanation:
Soybean.

	Further down the list are Garbanzos, Lima beans, and Blackeyes. I'm not sure how they would find this out, but I wouldn't want to try.

questions.text: Which of the following foods has the most calories?
questions.explanation:
Lard.

	Lard has over 900 calories per 100g.

questions.text: Which famous king would faint at the sight of a cat?
questions.explanation:
Henry III.

	He was deathly afraid of cats so much that if one came near him he would faint.

questions.text: In 1975, a man by the name of Alex Mitchell was watching his favorite TV show, "The Goodies". During a scene called "ecky thump" he laughed continously for half an hour, then suffered a heart attack. What did his wife do?
questions.correct: Wrote the show to thank them
options: Put the ashes on the television during that same skit in commeration
questions.explanation:
Wrote the show to thank them.

	She wrote them to thank them for making her husband's last moments on earth so happy. Mr. Mitchell died at the age of 50.

questions.text: In what year was the first ever parachute jump?
questions.explanation:
1797.

	Andre-Jacques Garnerin dropped from about 6,500 ft over Monceau Park in Paris in a 23-ft diameter parachute made of white canvas with a basket attached.

questions.text: All the integers from 1 to 1000 multiplied together (1x2x3...998x999x1000) give a result that has how many numbers
The rain in southern Europe is sometimes red because it contains sand from the Sahara. True or False?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Clouds pick up reddish sand from the desert and carry it across the Mediterranean.

questions.text: Which of the following rulers reigned the longest?
questions.explanation:
Pepi II, King of Egypt.

	Pepi II ruled Egypt for 90 years (2566-2476 BC). Louis XIV ruled for 72 years, John II ruled for 71 years, and Franz Josef ruled for 67 years.

questions.text: 'Pack my boxes with five dozen liquor jugs' is an example of what type of sentence?
questions.explanation:
Pangram.

	A pangram is a sentence that uses ever letter in the alphabet. Other sentences are 'The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog', and 'The five boxing wizards jump quickly.'

questions.text: Take the last letter of the first, second, and third country's that gave women the right to vote and what does it spell?
questions.explanation:
dad.

	The first country was New ZealanD (1893), second was AustraliA (1902), and third was FinlanD (1906).
